title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas  White (Tejo)
description: This wood-fermented wine is full of ripe yellow fruits that are cut by the acidity. It is dense with spice and a generous texture. The richness is balanced by the citrus acidity and the mineral edge. Age the wine for another year and drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas

title: Left Bend 2015 Gali Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Lemon skin and grapefruit pith show strongly on the nose of this bottling along with tons of nearly ripe white flowers. There is a lot of citrus character on the sip, which is almost too sharp with sourness but quite compelling and interesting. The super racy character will mellow a tad with time and make this more accessible.

title: Levendi 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Thick and heavy, this is a sizable wine from a mountain appellation that brings in tar, tobacco and meat. Moderate acidity gives it a succulent backbeat of blackberry and black cherry alongside mountain sage and dried dusty herb.

title: Franck & Olivier Mousset 2016 Tendance Caladoc Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Made from Caladoc, a grape variety created in 1958 by crossing Grenache and Malbec, this medium-bodied rosé is restrained in style, with ginger and citrus notes accenting strawberry fruit. It's dry and refreshing on the finish. Drink now.

title: Grizzly Peak 2014 Reserve Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: Though this wine's mouthfeel is chalky, its dark fruit, touched with black olive, coffee and licorice, offers interesting, complex flavors. It's tight, tart, lightly saline and peppery, with the fresh berry fruit flavors holding up through the finish.

title: Gruet NV Sauvage Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (America)
description: This 100% Chardonnay sparkler is full of lemon, yellow apple and pizza dough on the nose. Tart green apple, ripe grapefruit, orange and lemon show on the palate, with delightful carbonation carrying the flavors. This is a perfect party pour.

title: Hart 2 Hart 2014 Romantique Harmony Pilot Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Red (El Dorado)
description: Vivid berry flavors drive this medium-bodied, lively and firmly tannic wine. It has good acidity that combines with the fine-grained tannins for an especially tangy mouthfeel.
designation: Romantique Harmony Pilot Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown

title: Heimann 2013 Bikavér Red (Szekszárd)
description: This garnet-colored Bikavér blend is comprised of Kefrankos, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Sagrantino and Kadarka. It has cherry, raspberry and plum aromas and sour cherry, raspberry and smoked meat flavors. Nicely balanced, it has rounded tannins and a prolonged finish.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)
description: The wine is velvet soft with smooth red berries and gentle tannins. It has a line in acidity along with spice and a rounded texture. Drink this lightly wood-aged wine now.

title: King Family 2016 Crosé Rosé (Monticello)
description: This Merlot-based rosé is plush with a summer bouquet of strawberries, rose petals and clementines. The freshness continues onto the palate where there is also a lovely note of Pink Lady apple. Soft in feel, a decent acidity prevails and gives it a nice lift.

title: Trentadue 2016 Bellacana Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Unoaked, this wine is fresh and fruity with a simplistic foundation of acidity and structure that supports floral aromatics and crisp wisps of stone.

title: Coelho 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The winery calls this their “Bunny Cuvée” due to the rabbit on the label. It's well made, of fair value, with sharp details. Cranberry and raspberry fruit flavors punch through with a gentle streak of cola. The finish comes with a hint of composted earth.

title: Cartuxa 2015 Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)
description: An easy focus on fruit and flavor is the key to this ripe wine that is full of creamy apple and peach flavors. It is crisp, with plenty of acidity and a delicious, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 São Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)
description: The cork label of this rich, smooth wine is a reminder that Alentejo's vines are interspersed with the trees that provide much of the world's cork. The wine has a rich southern character, soft tannins and plenty of blackberry fruits. It is ready to drink.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Passion of Portugal Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a good example of a red Portuguese wine, showcasing soft, generous tannins and juicy red and blackberry fruits. It is ripe, full of fruit and rounded with a firm, dry aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Rabo de Galo Red (Algarve)
description: This rich wine comes from the far south of Portugal. It is structured and dense with black-plum fruit and firm tannins. Spice and grilled toast from wood aging and acidity gives this wine a good balance as well as ripeness. Drink now.

title: Castle Rock 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety smooth and big-boned, this wine shows crisp red fruit wrapped in tart acidity and subtle oak. Bay laurel, spearmint and green tea add savory complexity.

title: Caves Velhas 2015 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Douro)
description: A firmly tannic wine with a powerful structure, this is rich and well concentrated, with a solid character that supports the generous black fruits. Juicy and with good acidity at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
description: This wine has weight and considerable richness. Spice and an attractive perfume meld with the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. The Castelão grape is at home in this region, which shows in the sense of terroir in this bold wine. Drink now.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Part of a series that showcases major grape varieties, this wine brings out the creamy, green and apple-fruit character of the Chardonnay. It conveys hints of tropical fruits and a ripe apricot flavor. Balanced acidity lifts all this rich fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.

title: Domaine Adèle Rouzé 2015  Quincy
description: This full-bodied perfumed wine brings out ripe white and green fruits. With summer-flower aromas and plenty of acidity, it is attractive and crisply refreshing.

title: Domaine de Reuilly 2015 Pinot Gris Rosé (Reuilly)
description: Pinot Gris, with its pale-pink skin, is the grape of choice in Reuilly for rosés. With a color that matches pale rosés from Provence, the wine is lightly spicy while also dry. Its balanced acidity is just right. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2016 Tentation by Renucci Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: With its designer white bottle, this is obviously a statement wine. Yet, it's also deliciously fruity and crisp. With bright red fruit and a citrusy tang, it's lively and perfumed.

title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2016 Vermentino-Chardonnay White (Ile de Beauté)
description: In this attractive blend, perfumed Vermentino is filled out by broad, ripe Chardonnay. The result is a wine that, while light, also has a rich character. Full of fruit, it's ready to drink.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2013 Tanè Nero d'Avola (Vittoria)
description: This 100% Nero d'Avola opens with ripe plum, toast and vanilla aromas that carry over to the dense palate together with blackberry jam, licorice and mocha notes. Close-grained tannins give it a firm, astringent finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Bruliam 2015 Rocky Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Restrained and dusty in leathery tannin, this wine opens in the glass to unravel bold black-fruit and licorice power, offering stark succulence and moderate acidity on the palate.

title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2016 David's Block Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This wine's lime, kiwi and Asian pear flavors come with a spicy kick. Four months on the lees seems to have helped smooth out the midpalate, which leads to a pleasantly creamy finish dappled with hints of dried straw.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2014 Manchego's Fate Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is an immensely quaffable blend of 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Zinfandel, showing dark hibiscus, stewed cherry and roasted coffee on the nose. The flavors are fairly wound up at first, with cherry, vanilla and mocha most prominent. The acidity is medium and the tannins are quite sticky.

title: Waterloo 2014 The Harvest of Beulah Land Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: From the Frankel Vineyard in the Geneseo District comes this bottling, which shows punchy boysenberry and energetic blackberry fruit on the nose alongside gravel, graphite, charcoal and leather. Anise and dill are prominent on the sip, where black-fruit flavors are cut by char with a blueberry finish.

title: Alessandro Rivetto 2014  Barbaresco
description: This wine's dark berry cinnamon, blue flower and truffle aromas come together in the glass. The taut palate shows Morello cherry, cranberry and white pepper notes alongside firm acidity and somewhat grainy tannins.
